answers.answer: Hi,How are you? It is good to know that the diagnostic tests done were fine. Numbness can be caused by a variety of conditions such as nerve injury, pressure on the nerves, lack of blood supply to the area, and medical conditions such as diabetes, underactive thyroid, electrolyte imbalance, medication side effect, TIA, and even migraines. If you experience headache, hemiplegic migraine should be ruled out. If it persists, check with a neurologist for proper evaluation. Take care and do keep us posted.

question: what is causing random right side of my body head to foot numbness lasting from 1 min to longer ones 5 to 7 min followed by a sharp poke head ache in my left temple.  I have had every test, blood, MRI, MMA, EEG, EKG, etc. and everything comes back clear - what is going on
title: numbness
